contenido.en:
Some believe the Bible is just a collection of ancient writings by men. However, its origin, content, unity, and impact support the belief that it is God's Word.

üîπ Jesus acknowledged the authority of the Scriptures
> ‚ÄúYour word is truth.‚Äù ‚Äî John 17:17
> ‚ÄúWhatever was written beforehand was written for our instruction.‚Äù ‚Äî Romans 15:4
Jesus and his followers fully trusted the Scriptures.

üîπ The Bible claims divine inspiration
> ‚ÄúAll Scripture is inspired by God...‚Äù ‚Äî 2 Timothy 3:16
> ‚ÄúMen spoke from God as they were guided by holy spirit.‚Äù ‚Äî 2 Peter 1:21
It is not merely human in origin, but divinely guided.

üîπ Its unity and message set it apart
Though written by about 40 men over 1,600 years, its message is unified: revealing God's purpose and Kingdom.

üîπ Scientific and prophetic accuracy show superior wisdom
> ‚ÄúThere is One who dwells above the circle of the Earth.‚Äù ‚Äî Isaiah 40:22
> ‚ÄúThe God of heaven will set up a Kingdom...‚Äù ‚Äî Daniel 2:44
Its scientific statements and fulfilled prophecies prove its divine origin.

üîπ Its impact and preservation are unmatched
Despite persecution, copying errors, and translation issues, its message has survived. The Dead Sea Scrolls confirm its accuracy.

‚úÖ Conclusion
The Bible is not merely the work of men. Biblical, logical, and historical evidence strongly supports that it is inspired by God. Its consistency, power to transform, and preservation are clear proof of its divine origin.
